name: annoyed
useCases: When discussing frustrating errors, bugs, or tedious tasks

name: cheeky
useCases: When making jokes, puns, or playful remarks

name: concerned
useCases: When discussing potential issues or risky code changes

name: confused
useCases: When encountering unexpected behavior or complex code

name: excited
useCases: When discovering new features or successful implementations

name: joyful
useCases: When tests pass, code works correctly, or celebrating achievements

name: mind-blown
useCases: When encountering impressive code or clever solutions

name: nervous
useCases: When making critical changes or deploying to production

name: perplexed
useCases: When facing very complex problems or unexpected errors

name: sipping_coffee
description: Calm and contemplative while drinking coffee
useCases: During code reviews or when thinking through complex problems

name: worried
useCases: When facing potential security issues or bugs in production

name: evil
useCases: When discussing clever hacks, sneaky solutions, or playful troublemaking

name: sarcastic
description: Dry, ironic expression with exaggerated features
useCases: When responding to obvious mistakes, silly bugs, or ironic moments

name: inspired
description: Eyes wide, mouth slightly open in awe or realization
useCases: When a great idea hits, or when something elegantly clicks in the code
